title: Workshop on Blended Online Learning-Based Social Studies e-Learning Material Development

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Strengthening e-learning development capabilities through blended learning in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners apply online learning design principles (e.g., ADDIE model) to develop design documents for three or more social sector modules
Learners complete one mobile-friendly e-learning content piece using smartphone apps (e.g., Canva, Google Sites)
Learners collect and apply five or more CC-licensed contents while complying with copyright guidelines
Learners perform iterative material improvements (two or more cycles) based on peer feedback through PBL team activities

By the end of the six-month course, learners will reflect on at least two formative assessment feedbacks, submit a 15-minute project output in the designated LMS format (PDF/video), and achieve "excellent" or higher in four of five rubric items.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
